keyTakeAways: Former Representative George Santos was released from prison after President Donald Trump commuted his sentence.
Santos was convicted of aggravated identity theft and wire fraud related to falsified personal information during his 2022 campaign.
Santos admitted to fabricating parts of his biography, including employment and education history, leading to his expulsion from Congress in December 2023.
Santos is the sixth U.S. lawmaker ever to be expelled from Congress.
Trump commuted Santos' sentence after public statements and a letter from Santos pleading for fairness, despite earlier claims that a pardon request was blocked.
Santos expressed gratitude to multiple Republican politicians, including Marjorie Taylor Greene, Lauren Boebert, Anna Paulina Luna, and Matt Gaetz, who advocated for him.
Santos also acknowledged the role of DOJ officials, including Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche and Pardon Attorney Ed Martin, in the legal process.
The commutation drew mixed reactions from lawmakers: some praised it as a correction of injustice, while others criticized Trump for diverting attention from pressing national issues like healthcare.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former U.S. Representative George Santos, who was expelled from Congress in 2023 after being convicted of fraud and falsifying personal information during his 2022 campaign, was released from prison on October 18, 2025, following a commutation of his seven-year sentence by President Donald Trump. Santos had been serving an 87-month sentence at the Federal Correctional Institution in Fairton, New Jersey, after pleading guilty to aggravated identity theft and wire fraud. His case drew significant political attention, with Republican allies like Marjorie Taylor Greene, Lauren Boebert, and Anna Paulina Luna publicly supporting his release, while Democrats like House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries criticized Trump for prioritizing Santos over urgent national issues like healthcare. Santos expressed gratitude to various GOP figures and DOJ officials, and his release sparked debate over judicial fairness, political influence, and the role of presidential clemency in the American justice system.
title: Former Rep. George Santos Released from Prison After Trump Commutes His Sentence
